column4: hey guys, i need help changing the permissions of my njb mp3 player, but i don't know where/which file to chmod. Can somebody point me in the right direction?
where is it mounted?
when you plug in the device, run dmesg and see if it indicates where its located
thankyou, one second
usb 5-7: new high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 6
anything else show up/
did that help you?
not really, did anything else get listed?
um lots of stuff.
pastebin it
http://pastebin.com/717146
what kind of permission issues are you having/

i'm not sure, but i've been talking to the banshee guys, and they're telling me its permissions. It seems that in some circumstances writing to the player crashes banshee, while other times it doesn't.
I've never used a njb so I'm not sure where its located
gnomad2 has to be started as root to run correctly, also confirming the bad permissions idea.
will it say in the device manager?
possibly
as in /sys/devices/
say i find it. what do i do to change the permissions?
it would be in /dev/ I think
chown to change ownership, chmod to change permissions
